column4: i guess no one else gets a quick flash of a screen full of input/out errors right when their ubuntu 9.04 installtion comes to an end and they hit enter to reboot
ok, i'll ask another question then. what bootloader does ubuntu 9.04 install by default?
can you paste in the pastebin your errors
how do i get those errors so i can paste them, does it log them somewhere?
the errors during install flashed on the screen too fast, so is there a log somewhere?
can you boot with a live cd?
i can boot into the install of ubuntu fine, but i just wanted to know what the errors during install were
get a camera and take a pic, maybe you are just saying normal mesgs, not errors
it was a quick flash of input/output error
couldn't see the whole message, went too fast
i can't generate this again, only happened at the end of installing ubuntu
so errors upon installing ubuntu would be logged in the system log viewer?
I thought You had just installed it
yep, it's installed, but i was wondering if errors that occur during install can be found in the system log viewer?
